joelib2.sort
Class QuickInsertSort

java.lang.Object
  joelib2.sort.Sorter
      joelib2.sort.QuickInsertSort
All Implemented Interfaces:
DoubleArraySorter, IntArraySorter, LongArraySorter, XYDoubleArraySorter, XYIntArraySorter
public class QuickInsertSort
extends Sorter

Quick Sort combined with Insert Sort. This routine was developed for a algorithm lesson at the university of Tübingen in 1999.

See Also:
Comparator, Comparable, Arrays.sort(java.lang.Object[], java.util.Comparator), Sorter, InsertSort

Constructor Detail

QuickInsertSort

public QuickInsertSort()
Constructor for the mixed sorting algorithm. Combines the advantages of two sort algorithms. quick sort is good at unsorted arrays O(1), but bad at sorted arrays O(N^2) insert sort is good at sorted arrays O(1), but bad at unsorted arrays O(N^2) So this algorithm uses first quick sort and then for the smaller array fragments insert sort.

QuickInsertSort

public QuickInsertSort(boolean _randomize)
Constructor for the mixed sorting algorithm. Combines the advantages of two sort algorithms. quick sort is good at unsorted arrays O(1), but bad at sorted arrays O(N^2) insert sort is good at sorted arrays O(1), but bad at unsorted arrays O(N^2) So this algorithm uses first quick sort and then for the smaller array fragments insert sort.
If the array contains a lot of sorted parts, you can use randomization.

Parameters:
_randomize - if true the array is randomized.
